intro: Tinospora havilandii, commonly known as the Indian Moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange or red berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Tinospora havilandii is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine systems.
